Audrey_Auld-Mezera:
{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2022}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Audrey Auld-Mezera | image = Audrey Auld at Threadgill's in Austin, TX. Photo by Ron Baker..jpg | image_size = | landscape = | alt = Audrey Auld at Threadgill's in Austin, TX. Photo by Ron Baker | caption = Audrey Auld at Threadgill's in Austin, TX (2010) | birth_name = Audrey Auld | native_name = | native_name_lang = | alias = | birth_date = 14 January 1964 | birth_place = | origin = Hobart, Tasmania, Australia | death_date = {{Death date and age|2015|8|9|1964|1|14|df=y}} | death_place = Stinson Beach, California, USA | genre = [[country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-Songwriter | instrument = Guitar | years_active = | label = [http://www.recklessrecords.com Reckless Records] | past_member_of = [[Bill Chambers (musician)|Bill Chambers]], [[Kieran Kane]], [[Fred Eaglesmith]], [[Mary Gauthier]], [[Dale Watson (singer)|Dale Watson]], [[Kasey Chambers]], and [[Carrie Rodriguez]] | website = {{URL|http://www.audreyauld.com/}} }} '''Audrey Auld-Mezera''' (''[[née]]'' '''Audrey Auld'''; 14 January 1964 – 9 August 2015) was an [[Australian American]] [[country music]] touring [[singer–songwriter]]. She had released eleven albums and three EPs on her own Reckless Records label, and had recorded with numerous musicians including [[Bill Chambers (musician)|Bill Chambers]], [[Kieran Kane]], [[Fred Eaglesmith]], [[Mary Gauthier]], [[Dale Watson (singer)|Dale Watson]], [[Kasey Chambers]], and [[Carrie Rodriguez]]. She had songs recorded by various artists and songs placed on the FX TV shows "Justified", "Longmire", "NCIS: New Orleans" and "The Good Guys". She hosted songwriting workshops with inmates in San Quentin Prison in California from 2007 till 2013. Auld-Mezera died of [[cancer]] on 9 August 2015, aged 51.{{cite news|url=http://www.tennessean.com/story/entertainment/2015/08/10/singer-songwriter-audrey-auld-dies-51/31421879/|title=Singer-songwriter Audrey Auld dies at 51|newspaper=[[The Tennessean]]|date=August 10, 2015|accessdate=August 10, 2015}}{{cite news|url=http://obituaries.themercury.com.au/notice/187872002?random=1439253882358/|title=Tributes: Auld, Audrey (Mrs Daniel Mezera)|newspaper=[[The Mercury (Hobart)]]|date=August 11, 2015|accessdate=August 11, 2015}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+List of albums, with release date and label shown ! scope="col" rowspan="1"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="1"| Album details |- ! scope="row"| ''Looking Back to See''

(with [[Nina Gerber]]) | * Released: 2006 * Format: CD * Label: Reckless Records * Note: Recorded in December 2005 |} ===Extended plays=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+List of EPs, with release date and label shown ! scope="col" rowspan="1"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="1"| EP details |- ! scope="row"| ''Billabong Song'' | * Released: 2009 * Format: CD, DD * Label: Reckless Records (RECK0010) |- ! scope="row"| ''Wood'' | * Released: July 2012 * Format: CD, DD * Label: Reckless Records |} ==Awards and nominations== ===ARIA Music Awards=== The [[ARIA Music Awards]] are a set of annual ceremonies presented by [[Australian Recording Industry Association]] (ARIA), which recognise excellence, innovation, and achievement across all genres of the [[music of Australia]]. They commenced in 1987.ARIA Award previous winners. {{cite web|url=http://www.ariaawards.com.au/history/award/Best-Country-Album|title=ARIA Awards Best Country Album|publisher=Australian Recording Industry Association (ARIA)|access-date=9 April 2022}} {{awards table}} |- | [[ARIA Music Awards of 2001|2001]] || ''The Fallen'' || Best Country Album || {{nom}} |- | [[ARIA Music Awards of 2005|2005]] || ''Texas'' || Best Country Album || {{nom}} |- {{end}} ==References== {{reflist|1|refs= [{{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p792142|pure_url=yes}} Audrey Auld Mezera] at allmusic [http://www.recklessrecords.com/aa_bio.html Reckless Records biography] }} ==External links== * [http://audreyauld.com/index.html Official website] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Auld-Mezera, Audrey}} [[Category:Australian country singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Australian women singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Australian singer-songwriters]] [[Category:Australian women guitarists]] [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:2015 deaths]]
